H0.text: The Analects are the writings of which Eastern philosopher. Lao Tzu

H1.text: The Analects are the writings of which Eastern philosopher. Zhuangzi

H2.text: The Analects are the writings of which Eastern philosopher. Mozi

H3.text: The Analects are the writings of which Eastern philosopher. 丘

A4.text: The Analects were composed of sayings and ideas attributed to Confucius and his contemporaries.

A5.text: The Analects is a central text of Confucianism.

A6.text: Confucius was traditionally ascribed with compiling these classics within his school.

A7.text: Confucius is said to have amended and recodified the classical books inherited from the Xia-Shang-Zhou dynasties, and to have composed the Spring and Autumn Annals.

A8.text: Confucius is said to have amended and recodified the classical books inherited from the Xia-Shang-Zhou dynasties.

A9.text: Together with the Analects and Mencius, these texts became known as the Four Books.

A10.text: Zhuangzi (book) (莊子), an ancient Chinese collection of anecdotes and fables, one of the foundational texts of Taoism
